## Top markers and differential expression

In order to help with the identification of the different clusters we pull out the
most expressed genes for each cluster.

```{r top_genes}
if(!file.exists(here("outs", project, "top_genes_res0.3.tsv"))){
# Create object where instead of cells in cols we have the clusters with counts aggregated
summed_res0.3 <- aggregateAcrossCells(sce, id=colData(sce)[,c("originalexp_snn_res.0.3")])

# # Delete ribosomal and mitochondrial genes
# is_ribo <- grepl("^Rp[sl]", rownames(summed_res0.3))
# is_mito <- grepl("^mt-", rownames(summed_res0.3))
# keep <- !(is_ribo | is_mito)
#  summed_res0.3 <- summed_res0.3[keep,]
 
# for each column (aggregated counts) of the object extract the top genes
top_genes_res0.3 <- apply(counts(summed_res0.3), 
      MARGIN = 2,
      function(x){
        # get the gene names from the top 50 expressed genes
        names(sort(x, decreasing = T)[1:100])
        }
      )
# save result
write.table(top_genes_res0.3, file = here("outs", project, "top_genes_res0.3.tsv"), sep = "\t", quote = FALSE, col.names = TRUE, row.names = FALSE)
}
```

We compute here a pairwise differential expression between all the clusters. The results are saved in a list of dataframes, "markers_res0.3/markers_res0.3.RDS"
one for each cluster. A .csv file (that can be opened with a spreadsheet program) for each cluster is available in "markers_res0.3".

The default philosophy of findMarkers() is to identify a combination of marker genes that - together - uniquely define one cluster against the rest. To this end, we collect the top DE genes from each pairwise comparison involving a particular cluster to assemble a set of candidate markers for that cluster. 
Of particular interest is the `Top` field. The set of genes with `Top` $â‰¤X$ is the union of the top $X$ genes (ranked by p-value) from each pairwise comparison involving the cluster of interest. For example, the set of all genes with `Top` values of 1 contains the gene with the lowest p-value from each comparison. Similarly, the set of genes with `Top` values less than or equal to 10 contains the top 10 genes from each comparison.

```{r markers}
# compute markers
if(!file.exists(here("outs", project, "markers_res0.3", "markers_res0.3.RDS"))){
  dir.create(here("outs", project, "markers_res0.3"))
  markers <- findMarkers(sce, groups = sce$originalexp_snn_res.0.3, direction="up", lfc=1)
  saveRDS(markers, here("outs", project,"markers_res0.3", "markers_res0.3.RDS"))
  # save the top 100 genes for each one of the df
  lapply(names(markers), function(x){
    top_markers <- head(markers[[x]], 100)
    write.csv(top_markers, here("outs", project, "markers_res0.3", paste0("top_markers_", x, "_res0.3.csv")), quote = FALSE)
    }
  )
}
```

expressed genes the celltype identity of every cluster has been identified. # in progress

```{r result}
if (!file.exists(here("processed", project, "sce_anno_02.RDS"))) {
annotation <- read.delim(here("data", "young_data_cluster_names_anno_02_res03.tsv"))

celltype <- annotation$Celltype
clusters_named <- annotation$Cluster_name

sce$celltype <- sce$originalexp_snn_res.0.3 
sce$clusters_named <- sce$originalexp_snn_res.0.3

# add the celltypes as described above in the correct order to replace the levels.
levels(sce$celltype) <- celltype
# and the clusters named to keep the resolution
levels(sce$clusters_named) <- clusters_named

# relevel to get the appropriate order in the plots
sce$genotype <- relevel(factor(sce$genotype), "WT")
# TODO put in the perfect order, for now just alphabetical
sce$clusters_named <-
  factor(sce$clusters_named,
         levels = clusters_named[order(clusters_named)])
# 
# sce$celltype <- 
#   factor(sce$celltype, 
#          levels = c())

 saveRDS(sce, here("processed", project, "sce_anno_02.RDS"))
}
plotTSNE(sce, colour_by = "clusters_named", text_by = "clusters_named", text_size = 3, force = 1) + scale_color_manual(values = cols)
```

## Marker plots

Exploring the shiny app and the DE between clusters specific markers for each one of the subtypes is identified.

```{r final-violin, fig.height=25, fig.width=9, cache=TRUE}
annotation <- read.delim(here("data", "young_data_cluster_names_anno_02_res03.tsv"))

annotation <- annotation %>% 
  arrange(Cluster_name) %>% 
  unite(col = "markers", c("Celltype_marker","Subcluster_marker"), sep = ",", remove = FALSE, na.rm = TRUE)
markers <- annotation$markers %>% strsplit(",") %>% unlist() %>% unique()
plotExpression(sce, features=markers,
    x="clusters_named", colour_by = "clusters_named", ncol=1, scales = "free_y") +  
  scale_color_manual(values = cols) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust=1, vjust = 1)) 

```
